findings.title: Duplicating receipts to mint tokens from thin air
findings.description: Enables a hacker to mint tokens from thin air by duplicating receipts.

findings.title: Singlepass Compiler Vulnerability: Absence of wasm Feature Validation
findings.description: The Singlepass compiler lacks thorough validation of wasm features before compilation, which can disrupt the compilation process.

findings.title: Inconsistent TrieKey Implementation
findings.description: Within the TrieKey implementation, the structs and their methods for different records such as `Account`, `ContractCode`, `AccessKey`, `ReceivedData`, etc. are defined.

findings.title: Address Broken Links Throughout Codebase
findings.description: Multiple broken URLs have been identified within the project's codebase, documentation, and README files.

findings.title: Address Vulnerable, Outdated, and Unmaintained Dependencies
findings.description: Multiple dependencies are vulnerable, unmaintained, or outdated, including ed25519-dalek, h2, libsqlite3-sys, and openssl.

findings.title: Inherent risk with use of 'clamp' function for gas price validation
findings.description: The current implementation of gas price validation relies on the built-in 'clamp' function, which is prone to panicking if the condition for minimum and maximum gas prices fails. This could introduce instability and lead to node crashes in future iterations that allow users to set their own min/max limits.

findings.title: NearVM runtime crates has inadequate documentation and TODO annotations
findings.description: The NearVM runtime crates lack comprehensive documentation, and numerous TODO annotations are scattered throughout the codebase, including some with alarming content.
